explanation: The report is correct. In MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy the code performs memcpy(mhd_copy, buffer, size) after only checking that buffer != NULL and size != 0 (and that malloc(size) succeeded). Nothing in the function can guarantee that the object pointed to by buffer is at least size bytes long, so a caller-supplied buffer smaller than size will cause memcpy to read beyond the bounds of that object (undefined behaviour). That is exactly the situation MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is intended to prevent: the use of <string.h> functions must not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the referenced objects. The function either needs to enforce/verify the object size or must document and rely on a caller precondition; absent such a safe check or documented and enforced precondition, this is a violation.
